title:
Time-Like Heavy-Flavour Thresholds for Fragmentation Functions: the
  Light-Quark Matching Condition at NNLO
abstract:
Matching conditions are universal ingredients that describe how fragmentation
functions change when heavy-flavour thresholds are crossed during the
factorisation scale evolution. They are the last missing piece for a consistent
description of observables with identified final-state hadrons at
next-to-next-to leading order accuracy in quantum chromodynamics. We present an
analytical form of the matching condition for light-flavour to hadron
fragmentation function at next-to-next-to leading order. The derivation is
performed by extending the formalism employed in the extraction of the next-to
leading order matching conditions to the subsequent order, making use of
$e^+e^-$ annihilation cross sections. We obtain the first non-trivial
heavy-quark effect in the light-quark fragmentation functions and provide
results in Mellin space.
